00033 /**
00034  * \file
00035  *         Device drivers for adxl345 accelerometer in Zolertia Z1.
00036  * \author
00037  *         Marcus Lund√©n, SICS <mlunden@sics.se>
00038  *         Enric M. Calvo, Zolertia <ecalvo@zolertia.com>
00039  */

00041 
00042 #include <stdio.h>
00043 #include "contiki.h"
00044 #include "adxl345.h"
00045 #include "cc2420.h"
00046 #include "i2cmaster.h"
00047 
00048 /* Callback pointers when interrupt occurs */
00049 extern void (*accm_int1_cb)(u8_t reg);
00050 extern void (*accm_int2_cb)(u8_t reg);
00051 
00052 /* Bitmasks for the interrupts */
00053 static uint16_t int1_mask = 0, int2_mask = 0;
00054 
00055 /* Keep track of when the interrupt was last seen in order to reduce the amount
00056   of interrupts. Kind of like button debouncing. This can't be per int-pin, as
00057   there can be several very different int per pin (eg tap && freefall). */
00058 // XXX Not used now, only one global timer.
00059 //static volatile clock_time_t ints_lasttime[] = {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0};
00060 
00061 /* Bitmasks and bit flag variable for keeping track of adxl345 status. */
00062 enum ADXL345_STATUSTYPES {
00063     /* must be a bit and not more, not using 0x00. */
00064     INITED = 0x01,
00065     RUNNING = 0x02,
00066     STOPPED = 0x04,
00067     LOW_POWER = 0x08,
00068     AAA = 0x10,   // available to extend this...
00069     BBB = 0x20,   // available to extend this...
00070     CCC = 0x40,   // available to extend this...
00071     DDD = 0x80,   // available to extend this...
00072 };
00073 static enum ADXL345_STATUSTYPES _ADXL345_STATUS = 0x00;
00074 
00075 /* Default values for adxl345 at startup. This will be sent to the adxl345 in a
00076     stream at init to set it up in a default state */
00077 static uint8_t adxl345_default_settings[] = {
00078   /* Note, as the two first two bulks are to be written in a stream, they contain
00079     the register address as first byte in that section. */
00080   /* 0--14 are in one stream, start at ADXL345_THRESH_TAP */
00081   ADXL345_THRESH_TAP,         // XXX NB Register address, not register value!!
00082   ADXL345_THRESH_TAP_DEFAULT,
00083   ADXL345_OFSX_DEFAULT,
00084   ADXL345_OFSY_DEFAULT,
00085   ADXL345_OFSZ_DEFAULT,
00086   ADXL345_DUR_DEFAULT,
00087   ADXL345_LATENT_DEFAULT,
00088   ADXL345_WINDOW_DEFAULT,
00089   ADXL345_THRESH_ACT_DEFAULT,
00090   ADXL345_THRESH_INACT_DEFAULT,
00091   ADXL345_TIME_INACT_DEFAULT,
00092   ADXL345_ACT_INACT_CTL_DEFAULT,
00093   ADXL345_THRESH_FF_DEFAULT,
00094   ADXL345_TIME_FF_DEFAULT,
00095   ADXL345_TAP_AXES_DEFAULT,
00096 
00097   /* 15--19 start at ADXL345_BW_RATE */
00098   ADXL345_BW_RATE,    // XXX NB Register address, not register value!!
00099   ADXL345_BW_RATE_DEFAULT,
00100   ADXL345_POWER_CTL_DEFAULT,
00101   ADXL345_INT_ENABLE_DEFAULT,
00102   ADXL345_INT_MAP_DEFAULT,
00103 
00104   /* These two: 20, 21 write separately */
00105   ADXL345_DATA_FORMAT_DEFAULT,
00106   ADXL345_FIFO_CTL_DEFAULT
00107 };
00108 
00109 
00110 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00111 PROCESS(accmeter_process, "Accelerometer process");
00112 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00113 /* Write to a register.
00114     args:
00115       reg       register to write to
00116       val       value to write
00117 */
00118 
00119 void
00120 accm_write_reg(u8_t reg, u8_t val) {
00121   u8_t tx_buf[] = {reg, val};
00122 
00123   i2c_transmitinit(ADXL345_ADDR);
00124   while (i2c_busy());
00125   PRINTFDEBUG("I2C Ready to TX\n");
00126 
00127   i2c_transmit_n(2, tx_buf);
00128   while (i2c_busy());
00129   PRINTFDEBUG("WRITE_REG 0x%02X @ reg 0x%02X\n", val, reg);
00130 }
00131 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00132 /* Write several registers from a stream.
00133     args:
00134       len       number of bytes to read
00135       data      pointer to where the data is read from
00136 
00137   First byte in stream must be the register address to begin writing to.
00138   The data is then written from second byte and increasing. */
00139 
00140 void
00141 accm_write_stream(u8_t len, u8_t *data) {
00142   i2c_transmitinit(ADXL345_ADDR);
00143   while (i2c_busy());
00144   PRINTFDEBUG("I2C Ready to TX(stream)\n");
00145 
00146   i2c_transmit_n(len, data);    // start tx and send conf reg 
00147   while (i2c_busy());
00148   PRINTFDEBUG("WRITE_STR %u B to 0x%02X\n", len, data[0]);
00149 }
00150 
00151 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00152 /* Read one register.
00153     args:
00154       reg       what register to read
00155     returns the value of the read register
00156 */
00157 
00158 u8_t
00159 accm_read_reg(u8_t reg) {
00160   u8_t retVal = 0;
00161   u8_t rtx = reg;
00162   PRINTFDEBUG("READ_REG 0x%02X\n", reg);
00163 
00164   /* transmit the register to read */
00165   i2c_transmitinit(ADXL345_ADDR);
00166   while (i2c_busy());
00167   i2c_transmit_n(1, &rtx);
00168   while (i2c_busy());
00169 
00170   /* receive the data */
00171   i2c_receiveinit(ADXL345_ADDR);
00172   while (i2c_busy());
00173   i2c_receive_n(1, &retVal);
00174   while (i2c_busy());
00175 
00176   return retVal;
00177 }
00178 
00179 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00180 /* Read several registers in a stream.
00181     args:
00182       reg       what register to start reading from
00183       len       number of bytes to read
00184       whereto   pointer to where the data is saved
00185 */
00186 
00187 void
00188 accm_read_stream(u8_t reg, u8_t len, u8_t *whereto) {
00189   u8_t rtx = reg;
00190   PRINTFDEBUG("READ_STR %u B from 0x%02X\n", len, reg);
00191 
00192   /* transmit the register to start reading from */
00193   i2c_transmitinit(ADXL345_ADDR);
00194   while (i2c_busy());
00195   i2c_transmit_n(1, &rtx);
00196   while (i2c_busy());
00197 
00198   /* receive the data */
00199   i2c_receiveinit(ADXL345_ADDR);
00200   while (i2c_busy());
00201   i2c_receive_n(len, whereto);
00202   while (i2c_busy());
00203 }
00204 
00205 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00206 /* Read an axis of the accelerometer (x, y or z). Return value is a signed 10 bit int.
00207   The resolution of the acceleration measurement can be increased up to 13 bit, but
00208   will change the data format of this read out. Refer to the data sheet if so is
00209   wanted/needed. */
00210 
00211 int16_t
00212 accm_read_axis(enum ADXL345_AXIS axis){
00213   int16_t rd = 0;
00214   u8_t tmp[2];
00215   if(axis > Z_AXIS){
00216     return 0;
00217   }
00218   accm_read_stream(ADXL345_DATAX0 + axis, 2, &tmp[0]);
00219   rd = (int16_t)(tmp[0] | (tmp[1]<<8));  
00220   return rd;
00221 }
00222 
00223 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00224 /* Sets the g-range, ie the range the accelerometer measures (ie 2g means -2 to +2 g
00225     on every axis). Possible values:
00226         ADXL345_RANGE_2G
00227         ADXL345_RANGE_4G
00228         ADXL345_RANGE_8G
00229         ADXL345_RANGE_16G
00230     Example:
00231         accm_set_grange(ADXL345_RANGE_4G);
00232     */
00233 
00234 void
00235 accm_set_grange(u8_t grange){
00236   if(grange > ADXL345_RANGE_16G) {
00237     // invalid g-range.
00238     PRINTFDEBUG("ADXL grange invalid: %u\n", grange);
00239     return;
00240   }
00241   u8_t tempreg = 0;
00242 
00243   /* preserve the previous contents of the register */
00244   tempreg = (accm_read_reg(ADXL345_DATA_FORMAT) & 0xFC);  // zero out the last two bits (grange)
00245   tempreg |= grange;                                      // set new range
00246   accm_write_reg(ADXL345_DATA_FORMAT, tempreg);
00247 }
00248 
00249 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00250 /* Init the accelerometer: ports, pins, registers, interrupts (none enabled), I2C,
00251     default threshold values etc. */
00252 
00253 void
00254 accm_init(void) {
00255   if(!(_ADXL345_STATUS & INITED)){
00256     PRINTFDEBUG("ADXL345 init\n");
00257     _ADXL345_STATUS |= INITED;
00258     accm_int1_cb = NULL;
00259     accm_int2_cb = NULL;
00260     int1_event = process_alloc_event();
00261     int2_event = process_alloc_event();
00262 
00263     /* Set up ports and pins for interrups. */
00264     ADXL345_DIR  &=~ (ADXL345_INT1_PIN | ADXL345_INT2_PIN);
00265     ADXL345_SEL  &=~ (ADXL345_INT1_PIN | ADXL345_INT2_PIN);
00266     ADXL345_SEL2 &=~ (ADXL345_INT1_PIN | ADXL345_INT2_PIN);
00267 
00268     /* Set up ports and pins for I2C communication */
00269     i2c_enable();
00270 
00271     /* set default register values. */
00272     accm_write_stream(15, &adxl345_default_settings[0]);
00273     accm_write_stream(5, &adxl345_default_settings[15]);
00274     accm_write_reg(ADXL345_DATA_FORMAT, adxl345_default_settings[20]);
00275     accm_write_reg(ADXL345_FIFO_CTL, adxl345_default_settings[21]);
00276 
00277     process_start(&accmeter_process, NULL);
00278 
00279     /* Enable msp430 interrupts on the two interrupt pins. */
00280     dint();
00281     ADXL345_IES &=~ (ADXL345_INT1_PIN | ADXL345_INT2_PIN);   // low to high transition interrupts
00282     ADXL345_IE |= (ADXL345_INT1_PIN | ADXL345_INT2_PIN);     // enable interrupts
00283     eint();
00284   }
00285 }
00286 
00287 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00288 /* Map interrupt (FF, tap, dbltap etc) to interrupt pin (IRQ_INT1, IRQ_INT2).
00289     This must come after accm_init() as the registers will otherwise be overwritten. */
00290     
00291 void
00292 accm_set_irq(uint8_t int1, uint8_t int2){
00293   /* Set the corresponding interrupt mapping to INT1 or INT2 */
00294   PRINTFDEBUG("IRQs set to INT1: 0x%02X IRQ2: 0x%02X\n", int1, int2);
00295 
00296   int1_mask = int1;
00297   int2_mask = int2;
00298 
00299   accm_write_reg(ADXL345_INT_ENABLE, (int1 | int2));
00300   accm_write_reg(ADXL345_INT_MAP, int2);  // int1 bits are zeroes in the map register so this is for both ints
00301 }
00302 
00303 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00304 #if 0
00305 /* now unused code that is later supposed to be turned into keeping track of every
00306     interrupt by themselves instead of only one per INT1/2 */
00307 
00308 /* XXX MUST HAVE some way of resetting the time so that we are not suppressing
00309         erronous due to clock overflow.... XXX XXX XXX */
00310 /* Table with back off time periods */
00311 static volatile clock_time_t ints_backoffs[] = {ADXL345_INT_OVERRUN_BACKOFF, ADXL345_INT_WATERMARK_BACKOFF,
00312                                                 ADXL345_INT_FREEFALL_BACKOFF, ADXL345_INT_INACTIVITY_BACKOFF,
00313                                                 ADXL345_INT_ACTIVITY_BACKOFF, ADXL345_INT_DOUBLETAP_BACKOFF,
00314                                                 ADXL345_INT_TAP_BACKOFF, ADXL345_INT_DATAREADY_BACKOFF};
00315 
00316 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00317 /* Checks to see if an event occurred after backoff period (returns time period
00318     past since) or not (returns 0) */
00319 
00320 static clocktime_t
00321 backoff_passed(clocktime_t happenedAt, const clocktime_t backoff){
00322   if(timenow-lasttime >= backoff) {
00323     return 0;
00324   } else {
00325     return (timenow-lasttime);
00326   }
00327 }
00328 #endif
00329 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00330 /* Invoked after an interrupt happened. Reads the interrupt source reg at the
00331   accelerometer, which resets the interrupts, and invokes the corresponding
00332   callback. It passes the source register value so the callback can determine
00333   what interrupt happened, if several interrupts are mapped to the same pin. */
00334 
00335 static void
00336 poll_handler(void){
00337   uint8_t ireg = 0;
00338   ireg = accm_read_reg(ADXL345_INT_SOURCE);
00339   //printf("0x%02X, 0x%02X, 0x%02X, 0x%02X\n", ireg, ireg2, int1_mask, int2_mask);
00340 
00341   /* Invoke callbacks for the corresponding interrupts */
00342   if(ireg & int1_mask){
00343     if(accm_int1_cb != NULL){
00344       PRINTFDEBUG("INT1 cb invoked\n");
00345       accm_int1_cb(ireg);
00346     }
00347   } else if(ireg & int2_mask){
00348     if(accm_int2_cb != NULL){
00349       PRINTFDEBUG("INT2 cb invoked\n");
00350       accm_int2_cb(ireg);
00351     }
00352   }
00353 }
00354 
00355 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00356 /* This process is sleeping until an interrupt from the accelerometer occurs, which
00357     polls this process from the interrupt service routine. */
00358 
00359 PROCESS_THREAD(accmeter_process, ev, data) {
00360   PROCESS_POLLHANDLER(poll_handler());
00361   PROCESS_EXITHANDLER();
00362   PROCESS_BEGIN();
00363   while(1){
00364     PROCESS_WAIT_EVENT_UNTIL(0);    // should do nothing in while loop.
00365   }
00366   PROCESS_END();
00367 }
00368 
00369 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00370 /* XXX This interrupt vector is shared with the interrupts from CC2420, so that
00371   was moved here but should find a better home. XXX */
00372 
00373 #if 1
00374 static struct timer suppressTimer1, suppressTimer2;
00375 
00376 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00377 #pragma vector=PORT1_VECTOR
00378 __interrupt void
00379 #else
00380 interrupt (PORT1_VECTOR)
00381 #endif
00382 port1_isr (void) {
00383   ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00384   /* ADXL345_IFG.x goes high when interrupt occurs, use to check what interrupted */
00385   if ((ADXL345_IFG & ADXL345_INT1_PIN) && !(ADXL345_IFG & BV(CC2420_FIFOP_PIN))){
00386     /* Check if this should be suppressed or not */
00387     if(timer_expired(&suppressTimer1)) {
00388       timer_set(&suppressTimer1, SUPPRESS_TIME_INT1);
00389       ADXL345_IFG &= ~ADXL345_INT1_PIN;   // clear interrupt flag
00390       process_poll(&accmeter_process);
00391       LPM4_EXIT;
00392     }
00393   } else if ((ADXL345_IFG & ADXL345_INT2_PIN) && !(ADXL345_IFG & BV(CC2420_FIFOP_PIN))){
00394     /* Check if this should be suppressed or not */
00395     if(timer_expired(&suppressTimer2)) {
00396       timer_set(&suppressTimer2, SUPPRESS_TIME_INT2);
00397       ADXL345_IFG &= ~ADXL345_INT2_PIN;   // clear interrupt flag
00398       process_poll(&accmeter_process);
00399       LPM4_EXIT;
00400     }
00401   } else {
00402     /* CC2420 interrupt */
00403     if(cc2420_interrupt()) {
00404       LPM4_EXIT;
00405     }
00406   }
00407   ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00408 }
